utterance.speaker: Magician boy on stage
utterance.content: Welcome to the world of illusion. What is real and what is magic. This is what you will wonder as I perform feats that will astound you! As you see there's nothing up my sleeves. And this hat… just an ordinary old hat. Watch as I wave three times above the hat and whisper the magic words; and now…

utterance.speaker: Dory
utterance.content: Mom it's not working! It's ripped!

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: It's okay baby, it's just a little tear.

utterance.speaker: Dory
utterance.content: Hurry up, mom!

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: What are you so worried about?

utterance.speaker: Nicky
utterance.content: Sally's going to make fun of us.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Sally Ayerson?

utterance.speaker: Dory
utterance.content: She said her mom bought her dress as Bloomingdales. You had to make ours. We're going to look stupid!

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Do you girls remember that music we were listening to yesterday? That lady who sang about respect?

utterance.speaker: Nicky
utterance.content: Retha?

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Aretha. That's right. Do you think she had lots of money growing up in Detroit?

utterance.speaker: Dory
utterance.content: What's Detroit?

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: It's a city. The point is that she's one of the best singers ever. If Sally's mean to you again I'm just going to have to key her daddy's new convertible.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Do you know what that means? Good.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Did you speak to Chase and House yet? The disciplinary hearing.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: The McGinley case. That's not for two weeks.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Tomorrow. Scheduling disaster, you don't want to hear it. You gotta get the boys' okay to move the hearing up, and you gotta do that whole legal advice thing.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Can you ask someone else?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm asking you.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Let me work with Chase. House should have separate counsel.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Stop looking for whatever you're looking for. For the last month, House has been crowing that you can't work with him because you're just swooning in love.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: There is nothing approaching love in what I feel about him right now.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well if you can't work with him, it amounts to the same thing.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: We had a fight. It's awkward. Why not use another lawyer?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Because 40% of our lawsuits last year were about House. You can't work with him, you can't work here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's over-reacting.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You snuck into her shrink's office and read her private file. When Nixon did that, he got impeached.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you're saying I'm not allowed to have oral sex with an intern either?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes! And yes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The file got me on the floor of her attic with her pouring out her soul. The only thing I did wrong was get caught.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Where's Chase?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's too busy to service you until after work. I got a couple of minutes though. Feel free to say something like "What'll we do with the time left over?" Or you could just stew. That works as well. She stews before she gets violent.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: This one says you're okay with moving the disciplinary hearing to tomorrow. This one says I've advised you of your legal rights.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh huh, any legal rights I should know about?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. And you thought this was going to be awkward.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You shouldn't sign it. Postponing is almost always the smart thing to do. Tempers cool, memories fade.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They rule on me it’s done, right?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Yeah, but…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then let's get it over with.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Have you ever done a peer review before?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Good. Here's a misnomer - these are your bosses. This will cost you some money, some privileges, or it could cost you your career.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: All I can tell them is what happened.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: There's an objective reality to what happened and that committee is never going to know it. All they're going to know is what they picture happened, which depends a little on what you tell them, and a whole lot on HOW you tell them. May 11th.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Patient presented to the clinic--

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: What's her name?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's in the file.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Do you know it? Then use it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Kayla presented to the clinic with multiple joint and stomach pain. Dr Foreman was called in for a neurological consult.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Checking your sister's cerebral coordination.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: The thing is in her leg and her stomach. Wait in the clinic for six hours so she can play patty cake?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She could have gone to the ER last night.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Oh yeah? You wanna come over and baby-sit her kids?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Ok, patient comes from a family of jerks, I get it. Can you stick to the medicine?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Something wrong?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There was some uveitis.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Meaning?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Her iris - the color part of her eye - was inflamed.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Meaning?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Worst case, blindness, but there was an upside. It was weird enough to get House interested.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Young woman, joint pain. Gonorrhea is a possibility.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's probably articular; maybe rheumatoid.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's typically small joints, this hit her knee.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Takayasu's arthritis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Get a sed rate and serologies. Child proof. How many kids are hopped up on vicodin?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Gimme.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right, like I'd ever get it back. Chase.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Don't care about the vicodin.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Might not just be her arteries, could be all her blood vessels.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Vasculitis, with stomach pain… so Behcet’s.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, she'd have oral sores.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or genital. Go find them.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I thought she was Foreman's patient, why did you do the exam?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She'd have oral sores.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or genital. Go find them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa Foreman… Chase can handle the pelvic.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Any pain? Is it bad? This will go a little easier if you talk to me.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I umm… I just really hate hospitals.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: When I was 12, had my tonsils out. Got to skip school, lots of ice cream; made me want to be a doctor.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: My mom… died when I was 8 so… I spent months at Princeton General.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She died of DTs? Your mom? Bottles stashed around the house? Mood swings? That whole deal?

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: You've been there?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: My mom. Dad left, mom crawled inside a bottle. Made for a great Yr 12 of high school.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: You ok with your dad now?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Does your dad have anything to do with this story?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, it's just…

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Okay, I get it, the two of you bonded, which is why you probably haven't been sued. Patients never sue doctors they like. But keep it brief, ok? The panel doesn't like to think they're being manipulated when they're being manipulated.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She had some ulceration.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Confirming Behcet’s?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I gave her some prednisone, an antacid and I ran a pathergy test on her arm; takes 24 hours to confirm. Told her any doctor could check it out.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You didn't make an appointment?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nope. She just showed up.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Dr. Chase.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hi. All right, let's take a look. Okay, those little pustules mean it's positive. Talk to Nurse Previn; get an appointment with Dr. Broston in rheumatology. Behcet’s is very treatable. You're going to be fine.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Okay. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: And you were just chatting on the phone to someone and she just happened to run into you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's what happened.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: No appointment? No real examination?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just gave her the test results.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: So, lower standard of care, you really couldn't be expected to notice there was anything else wrong.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We didn't even go into an exam room.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: As your lawyer, I can't stop you from lying, I can't even be in the room, but I would be remiss if I didn't prep you to lie better. You wrote her a prescription, which means there was an examination. What really happened?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I was on the phone.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Dr. Chase? Hi.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Kayla. I'm here for the test… my arm?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh. Oh yeah… umm, okay. It's positive. Talk to Nurse Previn; get an appointment with Dr. Broston in rheumatology.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: I took that medicine you gave me? But my stomach still hurts.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Behcet’s can be stronger than we thought, or it could be reflux from the prednisone. This is a stronger antacid.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Doctor…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You didn't ask her anything about the stomach pain?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I made one little mistake.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: As little mistakes go, that was a biggie.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She's only advising Chase? Not you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well what's the committee going to do to me? I haven't even met this patient.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Your disdain for human interaction doesn't exculpate you, it inculpates you. You sign the charts, you're responsible for everything Chase does.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which is why this doesn't matter; she protects Chase, she protects me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Unless her advice to Chase is to make a deal and give you up. "I'm so sorry, if only Dr. House had paid attention, he'd never even met her, he never does."

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chase loves me. And isn't Turkish.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Cameron loves you. Chase loves his job.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You really think Stacy hates me that much?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I think right now she hates you more than enough. You think emotion only affects doctors’ judgments?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Everything stems from that one interaction; they're going to slam you on it. Were you distracted? Your problem? Overworked, that's their problem. Forgetful, yours, lazy--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I just figured the stomach pain was the Behcet’s. Any doctor would have thought the same.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Then why did you call her an hour after she left the clinic? Nurse Previn said you asked her to have Kayla come back in.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The way she hesitated I thought she might have had a doorknob question. Patient comes in, says he's got a sniffly nose; you examine him for 10 minutes right? Then you're leaving, hand on the doorknob, and he says "Oh yeah and my penis has turned green".

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Embarrassing question, only important when patient saves it for last, so you knew she was about to ask the most important question… and you left.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. I didn't. I figured it out later.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: What changed?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Bad answer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I wasn't thinking clearly at first.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Worse answer. What was her doorknob question?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I figured it might be blood in her stool, which could indicate a bleeding ulcer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Talk to me.

utterance.speaker: Paramedic
utterance.content: 35-yr-old female vomiting massive amounts of blood. LOC at work, BP 80 over 20, heart rate 140.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Push fluids?

utterance.speaker: Paramedic
utterance.content: Three liters in the field, and we're boosting another one right now. It's gotta be a bleeding ulcer, doc. Co-worker says that she's been eating ibuprofens like candy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I thought she had Behcet’s.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm in her stomach. There's too much blood, I can't see.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She burst an artery?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, there. Bubbling, just a bad ulcer. Cauterizing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Can't see, use more saline.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hold on! Okay, looks good.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Bleeding ulcer. We got it. She was fine 2 hours ago.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Systolic BP's 70.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where's the ulcer?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's brown. I cauterized it. It must be something else. There.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Second ulcer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not anymore. It perforated.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Get her to an OR!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The surgeons were able to suture the perforation. But the contents of the patient's- Kayla's stomach had spilled into her body. She got septic.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Then the infection lowers her blood pressure…

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: 50 over palp at one point. It damaged her liver and kidneys. Listen, I know this looks bad, I obviously got the diagnosis wrong but I did everything by the book. I couldn't have known what was going to happen.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: If I skip my coffee I get cranky. Do you want anything?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Why did Chase screw up?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He forgot to ask her a question, does there need to be a reason?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: It might help him.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: As far as I'm concerned, he made a little mistake. It happens.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: How far are you concerned?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You think I'm biased?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You're colleagues. You've worked together for over a year. And everyone says you slept together.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Who says?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: The correct answer is "We're not involved and I'm not biased".

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We're not involved; and I don't know why he messed up. House has worked with him longer than I have. You should talk to House.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Yeah. Why did Chase screw up?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Because he doesn't give a crap about patients.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Well he always gets positive patient reviews.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah. He smiles all 84 of his teeth, tells them his tonsil story.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: It's a nice story.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He still has his tonsils! As soon as he's out of the room, which is as soon as he can be out of the room, he starts in on the trash talk. Thinks not giving a crap makes him like House. Like it’s something to aspire to. Am I going to have to testify?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I won't be encouraging them to call you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What'd House say?

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: Two months like this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let me guess, no insurance, just heard about the free clinic. It's a good move. You don't want to skimp on the essentials like wristwatches, MP3 players…

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I need to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: From the doorway?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: It's confidential.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cool. I love gossip. Hear that crackling sound like crumpling up paper? Keep listening. Let me know if it changes.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Two questions. Why did Chase screw up and how bad was it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. Talk about efficient. I only need one answer - Chase didn't screw up.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: He said he did.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well I'm not a lawyer, but that seems like a sucky legal strategy.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: They're gonna wanna know what you think a reasonable doctor would have done in Chase's position.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If I thought he was a 'reasonable' doctor, I wouldn't have hired him.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: God you two are a couple of geniuses. Deny everything; completely fool the lawyer who's trying to help you. Too bad the review committee members are actually doctors.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Stacy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm in her stomach. There's too much blood, I can't see.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She burst an artery?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. There. Bubbling, just a bad ulcer. Okay, cauterizing; looks good.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Bleeding ulcer, we've got it. She was fine 2 hours ago.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If by ‘fine’, you mean she had fountains of blood spurting out of every orifice then yeah, I believe you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm guessing those are celebratory bells.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Systolic BP's 70.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Show me the ulcer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's brown. I cauterized it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sweep back, show me the whole stomach. Stop.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Second ulcer?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not anymore. It perforated.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Get her to an OR!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Let's go.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She was not fine 2 hours ago. She mentioned stomach pain?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah, so I gave her a stronger--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You didn't do an exam.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She just came in for a follow-up. The results of the pathergy test.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you listen to her stomach? Check her vitals?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe if she'd said something about taking ibuprofen, mentioned the rectal bleeding!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, why didn't she go to med school like you did?! Diarrhea! Blood in the stool! These are routine questions--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Doctors skip all the time! It was a minor mistake; I couldn’t have known this was going to happen--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Mistakes are as serious as the results they cause! This woman could die because you were too lazy to ask one simple question!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She might die because I had the bad luck to spill your damn vicodin pills!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And I responded with a number of trenchant remarks which made Chase cry, none of which I'm going to testify about.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unless you convince Chase to roll on me.

utterance.speaker: Patient
utterance.content: Excuse me, testify about what?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uhh… Chuck. I'm going to break from the parable of the wicked doctor and tell a little story about a patient. Let's call him… Buck, who has low O2 stats and crackling lung sounds.

utterance.speaker: Chuck
utterance.content: Like I have?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Buck has idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. His lung tissue's turning to rock. There's no known cause, no treatment. He is slowly suffocating.

utterance.speaker: Chuck
utterance.content: You're talking about me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lung transplant's about a half a million dollars, but this poor sucker's got no insurance. If he tried to sign up now, he'd be excluded, pre-existing condition. But let me confirm with my lawyer . She confirms. If only Buck hadn't been diagnosed with fibrosis before he got insurance. So... back to the exam.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: That's how you tell this guy he's dying?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh relax. He's got a cold, and soon, health insurance.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Such a hero; always righting wrongs. Who cares who you have to manipulate.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I didn't realize you and Buck were so close.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: It's a point of principle.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. It's got nothing to do with what I did to you.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: There's nothing for us to talk about.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's why you're following me. I read some notes--

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: If Chase screwed up--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was wrong. Terribly, terribly, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: If Chase screwed up so badly, why didn't you fire him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He has great hair.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: What are you hiding?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm gay. Oh, that's not what you meant. It does explain a lot though. No girlfriend, always with Wilson, obsession with sneakers...

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Diarrhea, blood in the stool. Two simple questions you could have asked her six months ago and averted this whole thing. You didn't ask either, why?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Judging from your question, and your demeanour, I assume you were visiting with House. Been over this, I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Good doctors don't make mistakes--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Good doctors never forget to ask questions? Then you've got your answer, apparently I'm not a good doctor!

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: FYI self-pity generally is not a good strategy in these hearings. What happened after the operation?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The kidney damage isn't so bad. The liver damage is more worrisome. There's no dialysis for livers.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I know, but if she loses her liver she can get a transplant, right?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We can put her on a list.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I could do it. I could give her part of my liver.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Surgeons won't operate unless the donor's had a long time to weigh the decision.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: There's black markets.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Those organs--

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Ooh… ohhh my stomach!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The pain constant?

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Ohhh… oh yeah!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sharp or dull?

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Oh I don't know!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's bad.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's a little cold. Appendicitis?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, it's a clot.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Nurse! Call the OR; we've got to prep her for an embolectomy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A CBC, PT and a liver panel.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sepsis had lowered her BP so much she got clots in her liver. They blocked the hepatic artery, cut off the blood flow. Her liver was shocked.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: And Cuddy listed her? With all the other problems?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Forget it. We can't give a liver to a woman this sick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you listen to what you're saying?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: There is no point in giving a new liver to somebody who also has vasculitis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Treatable.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And kidney damage.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's healing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know what's really killing her? Chase forgot to ask a standard question about stomach pain, so he missed the diagnosis, so she perforated, so she got sepsis, so her BP tanks, so she got blood clots, so she lost her liver. Livers are important, Cuddy; can't live without them, hence the name. And here's the big issue, Chase is a hospital employee, and Kayla is the sympathetic mother of those 2 jury-friendly moppets Caleb and Cody.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Dory and Nicky.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Your point, beyond just trying to make Chase wet himself seems to be that the hospital faces liability here. Well thanks for clearing that up. I still need a medical reason to list her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That is a medical reason! The family wins this hospital in a lawsuit; they'll turn it into condos. And people will die waiting outside a condo for medical care.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Start praying for a 12-car pile-up on the turnpike 'cause we're not exactly swimming in livers over here.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: When you're testifying, skip the details on how House convinced Cuddy. I don't think the people who got bumped down the transplant list need to know why.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It didn't matter anyway.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: She next on the list?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But she's AB negative. Very rare.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: How long can she go on like this?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Probably another day or two.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I'm donating my liver.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sam, we've talked about this.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I'm a perfect match; 6 out of 6 HLA proteins.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How'd you get checked out so fast?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I know a guy in medical testing and I paid him to rush it.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Sam bribed someone to rush his test?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Wouldn't you?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Someone's going to get the blame for what happened, so the more we spread it around... might as well--- you said no surgeon would do a live donor transplant on such short notice.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: House took care of that too.

utterance.speaker: Ayersman
utterance.content: Your patient's hardly clotting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sub-Q vitamin K and fresh frozen plasma pre-op.

utterance.speaker: Ayersman
utterance.content: Pretty risky.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well that's why I came to the best transplant surgeon in the hospital. She's dead without you.

utterance.speaker: Ayersman
utterance.content: Get her in this afternoon.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: Ayersman
utterance.content: My pleasure.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: And this was right before you ran the marathon, I suppose?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Was it the part where he warmly clasped my hands in thanks, was that too much?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: What'd you do to him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The hospital lawyer asks me if I did something unethical. If I did, the last person I tell is the hospital lawyer, especially since she's gone all 'old testament' on me.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You'll tell me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh. Ok then. One caveat, I've moved past threesomes. I'm now into foursomes. If someone backs out then you've still got a threesome. If two people back out, you're still having sex. You'd be amazed. Even if three people--

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Anything you say is attorney-client. So you can get advice about the bad, bad thing you did, knowing I'll be tortured because I can't tell a soul.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, it is kinda cool.

utterance.speaker: Ayersman
utterance.content: Are you completely out of your mind? She's dying on her own, why would I volunteer to be her executioner? I'd just be inviting a lawsuit from the brother, no matter what!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: 5 grand. And that's just ante money. After the surgery, you get another 15. Though I warn you, that includes the tip.

utterance.speaker: Ayersman
utterance.content: I make 600 grand a year; you think I'm going to risk tanking my percentages for 20 thousand?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's tax free.

utterance.speaker: Ayersman
utterance.content: For the record, I hope the department takes you and Chase and drop-kicks both your asses out the back door.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great; means I don't have to bother welshing on the 15 grand I would have owed you. If you don't do the surgery, I'm going to tell your wife that you've been sleeping with a series of nurses. Currently Nurse Cutler in Radiology. Now what's 600 grand divided by two?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Last Christmas party, Nurse Cutler handed you one of those little hotdogs. And you didn't thank her. Well that only happens when you're very, very intimate. That and the fact that you've been practically dancing around with your zipper open, used condom stuck in your shoe. Your wife is apparently the only one who doesn't know.

utterance.speaker: Ayersman
utterance.content: There is no way you'll tell her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course I won't. I'm much too cowardly. No, I'd just send an anonymous letter. Now I've uh... I've got an OR booked for 4 this afternoon. Are you free?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hmm. Oh, and for the record, you are the worst transplant surgeon in this hospital. But unfortunately, you're the only one who's currently cheating on his wife.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You bribed him and then you blackmailed him?!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She'd have been dead in 2 days if I hadn't made Ayersman do the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Leave the blackmail out of the story you tell the committee.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tried to leave it out of the story I told you.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: And then there was that incident in the parking lot.

utterance.speaker: Ayersman
utterance.content: Hey now! Don't do that! Hey what are you nuts?! Please, please! I didn't do it! I didn't do anything!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Apparently, someone sent an anonymous letter to his wife.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You blackmailed Ayersman before he performed the surgery and then you ratted him out anyway?!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doesn't seem fair, does it?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You just can't control yourself, can you? No matter how stupid, how self-destructive--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: To make this conversation easier, can we discard the fiction that we're talking about anything other than what I did to you? You're not mad because I broke into your psychiatrist's office.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Yeah, I was thrilled about that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, it was a lousy thing to do, but if what I'd found was that everything was all kittens and moonbeams in Markville, you'd be over it.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: No I wouldn't!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're mad at me for letting you know what I did because you liked where things were going. And for that I actually am sorry. It was stupid.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Let me tell you a story about a patient; the patient we'll call, Fusan.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because Sam had rushed his tests, we were able to get them into surgery that afternoon. Dr Ayersman performed the live donor transplant. He resected the right lobe, hepatic vein, and hepatic artery of Sam's liver, and transplanted it into Kayla. The operation was a success. Kayla and Sam continued to receive routine care.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Two months later, she came by for an exam.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: July 24th, be precise. You did the exam?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Honestly, I just wanted to--

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Honestly? So you've been lying up until now?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Let's make a deal. I won't use the word 'honestly', and you'll quit stopping by to see House so you don't take it out on me afterwards, how about that? I wanted to be as far away from Kayla as possible, but House was rubbing my nose in it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How are the girls?

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: They're great. Dory had her first crush, which was cute.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh yeah?

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: And then her first sort of break up, which was not so cute.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're hot. 99.3 You been coughing?

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Pain in urinating?

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: No. 99's not that high, is it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Immunosuppressants block fevers; you shouldn't have one at all. I'm sending a nurse in here to draw cultures, and I'm ordering a chest x-ray.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I wasn't making any more mistakes.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Another phrase to avoid in front of the committee.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She spikes a fever an hour later.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Her AST and ALT are up. She's rejecting the liver.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, it's just an infection. One of our cultures is growing a strep.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Just one? Probably a contaminant.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's dehydrated, her hematocrit's way up, it's strep!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Transaminases are up too.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's just stress from the strep.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Please, Chase, you and this strep. Get a room already.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's not rejecting the liver! It's just an infection, she'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Worst case we could re-list her.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: You House?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Umm... well that depends. Are you going to hit Dr. House?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: You haven't even seen my sister and you're being cute with me?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sam, we're talking about her right now. Her fever might--

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Could be Hep B, Hep C, right? It's treatable. You give her interferon, she's ok. Right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know a lot about hepatitis.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He just donated his liver.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're flushed. You sick?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I'm tired.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're hiding the fact that you're sick. Now why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Hey, wait, what are you…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now either you specifically asked for a tattoo of a heart that's been left out in the sun too long, or that is a really bad home job. It's a very common way of getting Hep C, which you have. You've had it a long time.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: It was going to keep me from giving my liver.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You paid off that lab tech to say you were clean?!

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: It hasn't been active in years. She was going to die if I--

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You paid someone off? That is TOTALLY unethical! Get an MRI for him and his sister right now.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: She got Hep from me, didn't she?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No! No, no, no, God no! I think she got cancer from you.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: House was right?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Brother had an undiagnosed hepatoma that was transplanted with his liver. Grew a lot faster in Kayla because she was immunosuppressed.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: How could House have known?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hepatitis can cause liver cancer. Plus her hematocrit, red blood cell count was high. Usually means dehydration, rare cases - cancer. We probably saved Sam's life.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We were able to operate on him early enough before it metastasized.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Kayla had already started rejecting the liver.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: And you couldn't re-list her because of the cancer.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Nothing we could do.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: This is good; the brother lying about his Hep. It's an intervening act, the proximate cause of her cancer and not your mistake.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She would have died six months ago if he hadn't given up his liver.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Maybe. Can't prove it. You need to come with me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Just been served with papers. Actually paper; one page. Defendant Princeton-Plainsboro hospital and Dr Robert Chase; blah, blah, blah. Medical malpractice, negligence; blah, blah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're surprised they're suing? You think people love Chase so much they're gonna just forgo--

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Punitive damages in the amount of 10 million dollars.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Punitives?! That means they're alleging gross negligence.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Well he's obviously out of his mind!

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Larry Wusekus. He's not crazy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ooh! I've been sued by him.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You have been hiding things and lying to me all day!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I haven't lied about anything. Except for the parts that I admitted I was lying about. And I'm not the one being sued. I feel funny.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Well what haven't you told us?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Before she checked out, Sam found her a second liver.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She had cancer, how could she--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Black market. There was a doctor in Mexico City who was going to do the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's leaving from JFK at 5.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: To meet some Mexican guy in the back of a van with a pig's liver and a hacksaw?! This is nuts!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You want to rat me out to House? He'll say if there's a chance in a billion then go for it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: This is not what she wants!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She's being manipulated by a morally guilty brother and a legally guiltier doctor.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You think she wants to die?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: She's dying either way.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Chase. How many people you know walking around with a black market organ from a third world surgeon, huh? This isn't going to be your salvation! It's just one more thing they'll pin on you! Go in there, be the good guy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: No, there's no time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Two minutes. Kayla, I made a mistake. I wasn't as blunt as I should have been about your odds. Probably didn't want to face it myself.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Dr. Chase, please don't do this.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Stress of the travel, the operation, even then, the cancer.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Kayla, we are going!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: My dad died. Lung cancer. I saw him a couple of months before it happened, we never talked about it.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I'm sorry your father died, but it has nothing--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He never even told me he was sick. I wish he had. It wou-- You're gonna die. Alone. Thousand of miles from your children, you don't want to do that to them.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Kayla…

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: I'm sorry Sam.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Kayla, you can't give up; if you do this, if you go home... I killed you.

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: No. You gave me 3 months. You gave Dory and Nicky 3 more months with me. And when they found my cancer, they found yours; and I got to save my baby brother.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A week later, Kayla died at home. Sam was furious. Gotta be why the big lawsuit.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are you buying this?!

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Of course not; there was no illegal transplant. There's no causation.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He was ready to kill me! Maybe he's lying to his lawyers.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Or you're lying to us. Last Thursday he saw you for post-op care. If you hate your doctor, you find another doctor before you find a lawyer. This guy didn't sue Cameron or Foreman. He didn't even sue House. Something personal here, something you don't want us to know before your hearing. The guy didn't hate you before that meeting, he hated you after.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So how's everything else? The girls?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Ah, you know... a lot of crying, some nightmares. We'll be ok though.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Girls are not going to be happy about leaving town though. They love that house, the yard, their friends.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're moving?

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Ever since the operation I've been on disability and there's the mortgage so… moving out of state somewhere cheaper. Anyways, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I killed your sister. I misdiagnosed her ulcer. Killed her.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Shut up man. She liked you, just--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I was hung-over when she came back to see me. I'd been up half the night drinking, had a headache and I just wanted to get the hell out of there. Couldn't have cared less what your sister was saying about her stomach pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: May I speak to my future former employee?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great story.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You think I'm lying? It's exactly what I told him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm sure it is. But you lied to him. You want him to sue you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I killed his sister!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I ordered black coffee this morning and got cream. Everybody screws up.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They didn't put poison in your coffee.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I've seen you hung-over. You weren't the day you blew his sister's diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What does it matter why? Is she less dead if I have a good excuse?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If I thought you'd screwed up because you were drunk, I would have fired you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You knew?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were depressed and distracted. I assumed you'd gotten a phone call from your stepmom.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This is Robert. Umm… what did he die of? That's impossible. I saw him two months ago, if he had lung cancer, he would have…

utterance.speaker: Kayla
utterance.content: Dr. Chase?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good news is, both your parents are dead now so… no reason to screw up this bad again.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How'd you know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's this interconnected network of computers, or interweb where you can--

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How did you know to look?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When he visited he told me he only had two months left. When you screwed up I did the math.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why didn't you tell me he was dying?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He asked me not to.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So you just hung me out there to be blindsided.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah Chase, it was all my fault. Look, you got a choice. You can either tell the truth, hospital settles, family gets some money, they get to keep their house. Or you can keep up this lie, family gets punitive damages, they buy a jet, they move to Park Avenue, and you have to find another career.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're not going to say anything?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm going to keep my mouth shut. Legally, it's better for me if you go down in flames.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Is Chase telling the committee about his dad?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't know. I thought you were going to get him to sell me out.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I wouldn't do that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: You're my client too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. And that's not going to change unless you leave this job. Or I do. So how do you deal with a coworker that you have feelings for - positive or negative. I don't want to end up like Chase, I don't want to get emotionally caught up and kill… you.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: It's not all negative.

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: Maybe you were right... maybe that is the problem.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what do we do?

utterance.speaker: Stacy
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: Dr. House.

utterance.speaker: Head Doc
utterance.content: After considering the testimonial and documentary evidence, this ad hoc committee in the matter of Kayla McGinley has reached a decision. Dr. Chase, your error resulted in a patient's death. You also lied, both to your superiors and the patient's brother. But taking into account the mitigating factor of your father's death, we've decided not to revoke your privileges. You'll receive one week's suspension and a letter in your permanent file. Now as for Dr. House… there is no evidence of a failure to supervise that would lead to disciplinary action. And yet, there is enough in the record to be very troubled by your conduct, including certain allegations of blackmail from members of the transplant team and by your general refusal to meet with your patients. It should be noted that your patient's cancer was diagnosed as the result of a direct physical examination of---

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not of the patient, I met the brother. Never met her. You want me to go to a family reunion every time I take on a patient?

utterance.speaker: Head Doc
utterance.content: The committee has determined that for no less than one month, Dr. House will have his practice supervised by another doctor, to be designated by Dr. Cuddy. This proceeding is adjourned.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you know this was coming?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: They contacted me about an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What's happening to Chase?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now you're fired!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, he's not.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Dr. House, meet your new boss.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Guess I'm his best friend now.
